thread.title: Inventor and InventHelp Client Develops Cooler Accessory (FRO-286)
thread.title_full: Inventor and InventHelp Client Develops Cooler Accessory (FRO-286) - CBS News 8 - San Diego, CA News Station - KFMB Channel 8

author: cbs8
title: Inventor and InventHelp Client Develops Cooler Accessory (FRO-286)
text:
InventHelp, a Pittsburgh-based invention company, is submitting the COOLER ACCESSORY to companies for their consideration.
PITTSBURGH, PA (PRWEB) October 20, 2015
"I hate when I open my cooler to pull something out, and then I find that my dry foods have fallen into the water left by the melting ice," said an inventor from Fresno, Calif. "Now they are soaking wet, leaving them inedible. I came up with this invention to keep foods separate."
He developed the COOLER ACCESSORY to organize the contents of a cooler. The unit keeps dry items separate from water left by melting ice. This ensures that dry goods remain dry in storage. It prevents foods from becoming soggy and inedible. The device separates beverages from the other contents. Additionally, it is adaptable for use with most coolers.
The original design was submitted to the Fresno office of InventHelp. It is currently available for licensing or sale to manufacturers or marketers. For more information, write Dept. 14-FRO-286, InventHelp, 217 Ninth Street, Pittsburgh, PA 15222, or call (412) 288-1300 ext. 1368. Learn more about InventHelp's Invention Submission Services at http://www.InventHelp.com - https://www.youtube.com/user/inventhelp
